column1: #text=When I was a freshman in high school we each had the opportunity to buy an inexpensive tree as part of the Arbor Day holiday .
#text=Part of the proceeds for the purchase were going to plant more trees in town .
#text=The tree I had was some kind of evergreen tree and I planned to plant it in the front yard .
#text=I asked my Dad where it 'd be best to plant it and we picked a spot where there were some flowers , but no trees .
#text=In order to plant it I read the instructions that came with the tree and started by digging a hole that was about twice the size of the root ball of the tree .
#text=It was a small tree so this was not a big hole .
#text=I then tried to make the hole a good shape before putting in some moss and fill dirt .
#text=I watered the tree that day and made sure to water it each day for about a week until we had a good rain .
#text=The tree grew and became quite large .
#text=The one thing I did n't realize is that I should have planned better for how big the tree was going to get because it ended up shadowing over the flower planters a bit .
